li.title: subspace
li.p: a subset of vectors in a vector space that itself is a vector space under the same addition and scalar multiplication operations as the parent vector space

li.title: trivial subspace
li.p: the subspace of a vector space consisting of only the zero vector

li.title: linear combination (of a collection of vectors \uvec{v}_1,\uvec{v}_2,\dotsc,\uvec{v}_m)
li.p: a vector that can be expressed as k_1\uvec{v}_1 + k_2\uvec{v}_2 + \dotsb + k_m\uvec{v}_m for some collection of scalars k_1,k_2,\dotsc,k_m

li.title: subspace generated by a set of vectors S
li.p: the subspace of a vector space consisting of all possible linear combinations of vectors in S; also called the span of Sspan, and written \Span S

li.title: spanning set (for a vector space)
li.p: a set of vectors in a vector space (or subspace of a vector space) where the subspace generated by the set is in fact the whole space; could also be called a generating set of vectors for the space

li.title: solution space of homogeneous system A\uvec{x}=0
li.p: the subspace of \R^n (where n is the number of columns of A) consisting of all solutions to the system
